[6]You will take command of the 62nd Regiment of Foot. At Fort William Henry under Colonel Munro. I will march the 33rd to Fort Edward. 
[7]Yes. You may. You there. What does Munro call you? The "Scotsman" has sent one of his Indian allies to guide you. 
[8]The Scotsman's daughters are at the Poltroon's house. A company of the 33rd will accompany you and Magua will show you the way. 
[9]Explain to the Major we care little about toying with colonial militia because we have little to fear from the French. They have not the nature for war. Their Latinate voluptuousness combines with their Gallic laziness and the result is: they would rather make love with their faces than fight. 
[10]Dismissed.
dialogues.CAMERON:
[1]Alexandria! Set three more places. How is Chingachgook, then? 
[2]Gettin' along. Yes, it is. Nathaniel. 
[3]Yes, I did. 
[4]It was a good year for corn. 
[5]You take much fur? 
[6]Dear Father, thank you for rewardin' the fruits of our labor with plenty. Amen. 
[7]I am stayin' on my farm. And any man who goes, his family is welcome to fort-up with us 'til he comes back.
dialogues.IAN:
[1]How far up the valley? 
[2]What then, Lieutenant? 
[3]You boys marchin' with us? What do you say? 
[4]Thought you and Nathaniel weren't joinin'-up. 
[5]And my cabin's not thirteen miles south of Cameron's! 
[6]You didn't think it right to be here in the first place. 
[7]But we are under English military authority.
